SCRP 150.courseDesc: This course introduces students to the core building blocks of “story” from the perspective of the entertainment industry, where stories are produced for mediums other than literary: film, television, the stage, graphic novels, or video games. Through readings, lectures, discussions and screenings, the class delves into the unique considerations of stories created or adapted for production as visual entertainment artifacts. Analytic examinations of core story-telling differences between various mediums will also be highlighted, to give students insight in later production and studies courses in their chosen medium of expression.
SCRP 150.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 220.courseDesc: Introduces the basic tenets of playwriting and applies their use towards the writing of a 10-minute play.
SCRP 220.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 225.courseDesc: Builds on the writing tenets learned in Playwriting I. Requires students to write a one-act play.
SCRP 225.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 230.courseDesc: Students will write a short play and then go through the rewrite process while working with a director and student actors. The final scenes will be performed in front of an audience.
SCRP 230.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
SCRP 230.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits

SCRP 241.courseDesc: Teaches the essentials of situation comedy writing for TV. Students will be expected to conceive and write their own thirty-minute pilot script plus a ‘bible’ for their show.
SCRP 241.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 242.courseDesc: Teaches the essentials of writing the one-hour television drama. Students will be expected to conceive and write their own thirty-minute pilot script plus a ‘bible’ for their show.
SCRP 242.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 250.courseDesc: Deals with the conception, writing and performance of a stand-up comedy routine. Includes exploration of creating a comic persona, structuring an act, construction of jokes, and aspects relating to perfromance. "Final exam" will be given before a live audience at a public venue.
SCRP 250.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 255.courseDesc: This one-credit course will explore a single film -- of the professor’s choosing -- in depth. Our approach is to watch the film intensely in order to understand its status as a critically lauded signature film, appreciate its aesthetic accomplishment, gain insight into the director’s cinematic style and preoccupations, and, by extension, deepen our understanding of how classic cinema works.
SCRP 255.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
SCRP 255.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 3 credits

SCRP 260.courseDesc: This course will introduce the student to the history, theory, language and disciplines of writing the American comic book and graphic novel. Students will learn about comic script-writing formats, the collaborative relationship between writer and artist, and techniques to strengthen both their writing and critiquing abilities.
SCRP 260.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 270.courseDesc: Workshop course that covers the fundamentals of writing scripts for film and television.
SCRP 270.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
SCRP 270.prereqs: ENGL 101 [Min Grade D] or ENGL 105 [Min Grade D] or ENGL 111 [Min Grade D]

SCRP 275.courseDesc: Workshop course that builds on the fundamentals of screenwriting learned in Screenwriting I. Each student develops and completes a short dramatic screenplay.
SCRP 275.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 280.courseDesc: This course will focus on creating scripts for films under thirty minutes in length.
SCRP 280.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 281.courseDesc: Writing Episodic Shorts is a course targeted primarily at Film & Television Majors with sophomore standing and above. This course will focus on creating scripts for web series under thirty minutes in length. The goal for the ten weeks is to have students develop short scripts that serve as first-draft scripts for production classes within the FMTV curriculum.
SCRP 281.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 290.courseDesc: A non-technical course which examines the differences between film & TV works vs. games and interactive fiction forms, and the creative changes inherent in translating one to the other. Emphasis given to the creation of a vibrant, seductive, logically consistent game world. Course culminates in the design of a game based on an existing work of fiction.
SCRP 290.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 295.courseDesc: Encourages students to use their knowledge of the current state of the art in gaming, and their technical and writing interests and expertise, to imagine games that go beyond those currently available. Of particular interest are ways to create branching narratives that deliver the story satisfaction and character development expected from traditional media.
SCRP 295.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 310.courseDesc: This course provides exposure to literary traditions from the classics to pop culture, analyzing how the selected books have affected the film industry, both in terms of direct adaptations and by influencing generations of filmmakers and screenwriters.
SCRP 310.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 320.courseDesc: This course is a close examination of a single video game studio each term. The course will look at all their current products as well as their company history to reach an understanding of their success story. Special attention will be given to the ways the company frequently differs from other video game companies and companies of similar size. Students will experience these concepts in a hands-on approach by playing through a variety of games, supported with critical classroom discussions.
SCRP 320.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 350.courseDesc: Students will write episodes of an ongoing TV comedy series produced at Drexel. Following the network primetime model and working in collaboration, students will work under budget, production and deadline constraints similar to those in the real world.
SCRP 350.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
SCRP 350.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 6 credits

SCRP 353.courseDesc: Students will write episodes of an ongoing TV drama series to be produced at Drexel. Following the network primetime model and working in collaboration, students will work under budget, production and deadline constraints similar to those in the real world.
SCRP 353.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
SCRP 353.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 6 credits

SCRP 360.courseDesc: Students are given the opportunity to interact with show business creative professionals, including writers, actors, directors, animators, editors and others. Guests will present their work and then discuss it in a free-form Q&A session.
SCRP 360.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 370.courseDesc: This course provides a thorough understanding of methods used to develop story ideas from initial concept to complete screen story, including pitching, structuring, and creating treatments. Students pitch and develop several stories which can then be used to create full-length scripts in advanced workshops.
SCRP 370.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 377.courseDesc: This course embeds Screenwriting students on a team developing a computer game from concept to design document and through production. Screenwriting majors will be expected to contribute heavily to the narrative, character and other non-technical aspects of game creation.
SCRP 377.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
SCRP 377.prereqs: SCRP 290 [Min Grade C] and SCRP 295 [Min Grade C]

SCRP 378.courseDesc: This course embeds Screenwriting students on a team developing a computer game from concept to design document and through production. Screenwriting majors will be expected to contribute heavily to the narrative, character and other non-technical aspects of game creation.
SCRP 378.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 380.courseDesc: The first of a two-course sequence in which students write a feature film script, telefilm, or television pilot.
SCRP 380.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
SCRP 380.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 6 credits
SCRP 380.prereqs: SCRP 275 [Min Grade D] or SCRP 370 [Min Grade D]

SCRP 381.courseDesc: The second of a two-course sequence in which students write a feature film script, telefilm, or television pilot.
SCRP 381.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
SCRP 381.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 6 credits

SCRP 382.courseDesc: The first of a two-course sequence in which students write a 90-minute, two-act play.
SCRP 382.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
SCRP 382.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 6 credits

SCRP 383.courseDesc: The second of a two-course sequence in which students write a 90-minute, two-act play.
SCRP 383.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
SCRP 383.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 6 credits

SCRP 384.courseDesc: This two-term workshop will lead you through the process of developing and writing at least one draft of the script for either several issues of an original comic or a complete graphic novel. The finished script will be expected to conform to professional standards in everything from length to plot structure to formatting. You will be expected to utilize skills taught in the prerequisite course,SCRP 260(Comic Book Writing), as well as narrative skills learned inSCRP 270(Screenwriting I), including, but not limited to, thinking visually, establishing characters through behavior, writing effective dialogue, the basics of story structure, and related topics.
SCRP 384.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 385.courseDesc: This two-term workshop will lead you through the process of developing and writing at least one draft of the script for either several issues of an original comic or a complete graphic novel. The finished script will be expected to conform to professional standards in everything from length to plot structure to formatting. You will be expected to utilize skills taught in the prerequisite course,SCRP 260(Comic Book Writing), as well as narrative skills learned inSCRP 270(Screenwriting I), including, but not limited to, thinking visually, establishing characters through behavior, writing effective dialogue, the basics of story structure, and related topics.
SCRP 385.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 495.fullName: Senior Project in Dramatic Writing I
SCRP 495.courseDesc: The first of a three-course sequence in which students write a feature film script, telefilm, full-length stage play, television pilot, at least two spec episodes of an existing one-hour TV drama or four of an existing TV comedy.
SCRP 495.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
SCRP 495.prereqs: SCRP 381 [Min Grade D] or SCRP 383 [Min Grade D]

SCRP 496.fullName: Senior Project in Dramatic Writing II
SCRP 496.courseDesc: The second of a three-course sequence in which students write a feature film script, telefilm, television pilot, at least two spec episodes of an existing one-hour TV drama or four of an existing TV comedy.
SCRP 496.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

SCRP 497.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
